references:
The ML model is here trained to detect the human subject in R=10ğ‘…10R=10
Region Of Interests (ROIs), namely potential collaborative situations
characterized by different human-robot (HR) distances or DOAs. In
particular, the ROI with label yh=0subscriptğ‘¦â„0y_{h}=0 corresponds to the robot
and the corresponding human worker cooperating at a safe distance
(distance â‰¥2absent2\geq 2 m), the remaining 999 labels (yh>0subscriptğ‘¦â„0y_{h}>0) identify
the human operator as working close by the robot, at variable distances
and DOAs as depicted in Table I. The range-azimuth measurements
ğ±hsubscriptğ±â„\mathbf{x}_{h} are collected independently by the individual devices
using a dedicated radar DSP (C674x). The corresponding labels yhsubscriptğ‘¦â„y_{h}
are associated manually during training stages and stored locally.
Federated model training is then implemented to replace data fusion
and using an ARM-Cortex-A57 SoC (Jetson Nano device model). Notice
that the radars collect a large amount of data, that cannot be shipped
back to the server for training and inference, due to the latency
constraints imposed by the localization service and safety policies
[30].
